qa_pairs.question: In a linear arrangement of 8 people, A sits at one of the ends, and B sits third to the right of A. C sits second to the left of B, and D sits at the other end. Step 2: B is third to the right of A, so the arrangement so far is A _ _ B _ _ _ D. Step 3: C is second to the left of B, placing C in the sequence as A _ C B _ _ _ D. Step 4: E sits next to C, and since C is already determined to be two positions from B, E must be on the other side of C, making the arrangement A _ C E B _ _ D or A E C B _ _ D. Step 5: Considering F sits next to D and G and H sit next to each other without being at the ends, we have to fit F, G, and H into the remaining spots. Step 6: Given G is not at either end, the only configuration that fits all constraints and allows G and H to be together (not at ends) while F is next to D is A E C B F G H D. Step 7: Thus, C sits to the immediate left of E.
